metadata.title: Modeling and Prediction of Extreme Weather Events Using Atmospheric Data

affiliation.institution: Department of Meteorology, University of Karachi

abstract.text: Weather prediction relies on atmospheric observations and numerical models. This paper studies large-scale weather systems and their role in extreme events such as heatwaves, floods, and cyclones.

body_text.text: Atmospheric dynamics govern the formation of weather patterns. Temperature gradients, pressure systems, and moisture transport play a crucial role in determining weather conditions.
Meteorological data from satellites and ground stations were analyzed using numerical weather prediction models.
Results indicate improved forecasting accuracy when high-resolution temporal data is incorporated.
